page.title: 13The Making of Whisky
page.content: Grant's whisky is a grain whisky distilled from maize which is imported from America at the rate of 2000 tons per week. In a continuous "cooking" process, the cleaned grain is ground into grist and mashed. The worts are then extracted,removed for fermentation and mixed with yeast in the washbacks. When fermentation is over the wash goes into the still for distillation. { ****}PROCESSES{****} 1.{Milling _}Takes all the waste out of the grain. 2.{Mashing_}Softens the grain to pulp. 3.{Distilling}_ Lets the grain pulp ferment. 4.{Cleaning}_ The pulp is put in a mesh bag to take out all the dirt. 5. {Reboiling}_To a certain temperature for gin,vodka or whisky.
